```{r lib}
# source class1 function
source("oneclass-pred.R")


# Load libraries
library(e1071)
library(dplyr)
library(mvtnorm)
library(ggplot2)
```




```{r sim1}
# Simulate data
N <- 500
mean1 <- 1 * c(10, 10)
sig2 <- 1
c1 <- 0.6
corr <- cbind(c(1, c1), c(c1, 1))
sigma1 <- sig2 * corr
x <- rmvnorm(N, mean = mean1, sigma = sigma1)
```


# Plot of the simulated two dimensional data- this has two features

```{r plot1}
# Plot data
plot(x[, 1], x[, 2], xlim = c(-1, 15), ylim = c(-1, 15))

```





```{r simfun}
# function to simulate data
simfun <- function(x, k1, gam1, nu1, deg1) {
	svm_modelN <- list()
	for(i in 1 : length(gam1)) {
		svm_modelN[[i]] <- list()
		for(j in 1 : length(nu1)) {
			svm_modelN[[i]][[j]] <- list()
			for(k in 1 : length(deg1)) {
				
				svm_modelN[[i]][[j]][[k]] <- svm(x, kernel = k1, scale = F, 
					type = "one-classification", gamma = gam1[i], nu = nu1[j], degree = deg1[k])
			}
		}
	}
	svm_modelN
}


```



```{r fun2}



plotfun <- function(x, svm_modelN, gams = NULL, nus = NULL, degs = NULL) {
	
	# For each predicted plot
	pred2 <- TRUE
	xdat <- x
	for(i in 1 : length(svm_modelN)) {
		if(i > 1) {
			xdat <- rbind(xdat, x)
		}
		pred2 <- c(pred2, predict(svm_modelN[[i]]))
	}
	pred2 <- pred2[-1]
	# Specify colors based on predictions
	cols <- ifelse(pred2, "Normal", "Anomalous")
	cols2 <- brewer.pal(3, "Dark2")[1 : 2]
	# Plot points by prediction
	s1 <- sign(mean1[1])
	lims <- sort(c(mean1[1] + s1 * 5, s1), decreasing = F)



	type1 <- ifelse(is.null(gams), ifelse(is.null(nus), "Degree", "Nu"),  "Gamma")
	type2 <- rep(c("Default", type2), each = nrow(x))
	newdat <- data.frame(xdat, cols, paste0(type1, " = ", type2))
	colnames(newdat) <- c("x1", "x2", "pred", "type")

	ggplot(newdat, aes(x = x1, y = x2, col = pred)) + 
		geom_point(size = 5) + 
		facet_wrap( ~ type) +
		theme_bw() +
		theme(text = element_text(size = 20)) +

		scale_colour_manual(name = "", values = cols2)
}

```

# Linear kernel


```{r lin}
k1 <- "linear"
deg1 <- c(3)
nu1 <- c(0.01, 0.1, 0.2, 0.4, 0.8)
gam1 <- c(0.01, 0.1, 1, 5)
simlin <- simfun(x, k1, gam1, nu1, deg1) 
```




# Polynomial kernel


```{r poly}

```
